page.title: 06CHERRY BURTON-5
page.content: Cherry Burton Parish has a population of 1345 with 436 households.This includes Cherry Burton itself,Gardham and several outlying farms.The village has a Parish Council made up of nine members elected by its residents every four years.The job of the Council is to provide allotments,street lighting, open areas and to assist Beverley Borough Council on planning applications within the village.It also channels complaints and comments about matters dealt with by District and County Council.The Parish Council has an agency agreement with Beverley Borough.This means that the Parish Council does not levy its own rate from residents but applies to the District Council for its annual expenditure.This agreement also applies to the Parish Council of Etton and others in the district.
